page.title: 11Law and Order in Morwenstow
page.content: Law and order are defined by common and statute law. Statute law is enacted by Parliament being the elected legislature of the country. The enforcing of the law and maintenance of order is the responsibility of the{Devon and {Cornwall Constabulary}(total strength 2,734). Morwenstow is policed from Bude which has a strength of 17 men. From this complement, a 24 hour patrol system is maintained with the use of patrol vehicles fitted with VHF/UHF radios. The radio gives access to PNC which keeps records of missing persons, stolen vehicles etc. However, each parish within the Bude section area has a community officer who will deal with all matters for that parish. He is also responsible for the forming of contacts within the parish.
